titlestmt.author: Manuscript, Archives, and Rare Book Library, Emory University

address.addressline: Manuscript, Archives, and Rare Book Library

did.physdesc: 39 linear ft.(78 boxes) and 12 oversized papers (OP)
did.abstract: Personal and literary papers of Irish poet and translator, Desmond O'Grady from 1953-2001.
did.repository: Emory UniversityManuscript, Archives, and Rare Book Library

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on access
accessrestrict.p: Special restrictions apply: Letters by Seamus Heaney are closed to researchers.
Collection stored off-site. Researchers must contact MARBL in advance to access this collection.

userestrict.head: Terms Governing Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: All requests subject to limitations noted in departmental policies on reproduction.

prefercite.head: Citation
prefercite.p: [after identification of item(s)], Desmond O'Grady papers, Manuscript, Archives, and Rare Book Library, Emory University.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Desmond O'Grady was born in 1935 in Limerick, Ireland. He holds an M.A. and Ph.D from Harvard University. He is a charter member of Aosdana and served as the Irish representative to Congress of the Community of European Writers in 1962 and 1965. His published works include volumes of poetry, Chords and Orchestrations, Reilly, The Dark Edge of Europe, The Dying Gaul, Hellas, Separations, Stations, Sing Me Creation, His Skaldcrane's Nest, The Wandering Celt, Alexandrian Notebook, and Tipperary; and translations Off Licence, The Gododdin, A Limerick Rake, Grecian Glances, The Seven Arab Odes, Ten Modern Arab Poets, and Trawling Tradition. O'Grady is the father of three children, Deirdre Anne Maria, Leonard John Jules, and Gisele Eleanor Anne.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Desmond O'Grady papers include literary and personal papers of the poet and translator, Desmond O'Grady from 1953-2001. The bulk of the collection consists of drafts of O'Grady's own writings, including poems from Chords and Orchestrations, Reilly, The Dark Edge of Europe, The Dying Gaul, Hellas, Separations, Stations, Sing Me Creation, His Skaldcrane's Nest, The Wandering Celt, Alexandrian Notebook, and Tipperary and translations from Off Licence, The Gododdin, A Limerick Rake, Grecian Glances, The Seven Arab Odes, Ten Modern Arab Poets, and Trawling Tradition. Also present are extensive files of personal and literary correspondence including letters from Samuel Beckett, Seamus Heaney, Derek Mahon, James Simmons, and Richard Ellmann. The collection also includes writings by others, personal files (including diaries and other personal items), collected printed material either by or about Desmond O'Grady, photographs, and sound recordings.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Organized into six series: (1) Correspondence, (2) Writings by Desmond O'Grady, (3) Writings of others, (4) Personal files, (5) Printed material, and (6) Audio-visual materials.

otherfindaid.head: Finding Aid Note
otherfindaid.p: A selected index of prominent correspondents is available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The correspondence series in the Desmond O'Grady papers includes letters dating from 1953-2001, with the largest portion from the 1980's and 1990's. Literary correspondents include Samuel Beckett, Seamus Heaney, Derek Mahon, Peter Fallon, Edward Said, and Richard Ellmann. There is a small amount of restricted correspondence from Seamus and Marie Heaney.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Arranged in chronological order with restricted correspondence filed at the end.

otherfindaid.head: Finding Aid Note
otherfindaid.p: A selected index of prominent correspondents is available.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on access
accessrestrict.p: Special restrictions apply: Letters by Seamus Heaney are closed to researchers.

did.unittitle: Greeting cards, undated from indexed correspondents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The writings by Desmond O'Grady found in this series include collected and uncollected poems, prose, translations by O'Grady, translations of O'Grady, and notebooks. In Subseries 2.1a individual poems are filed alphabetically within each collection; the collections are arranged chronologically by publication date. Included in Subseries 2.1b are several uncollected poems, arranged alphabetically. When multiple poems appear on a single manuscript page, cross references have been provided. O'Grady's prose is located in Subseries 2.2 and is arranged alphabetically and divided under the headings, Essays, Articles, and Reviews, Short Stories and Novels, and Drama. Subseries 2.3 contains several of O'Grady's drafts of translations. Individual translations are filed alphabetically by author within each collection; the collections are arranged chronologically by publication date. Subseries 2.4 contains Italian translations of O'Grady's work and arranged alphabetically by title.

Subseries 2.5 contains several of O'Grady's manuscript notebooks. These notebooks contain manuscript drafts of poems from Tipperary, as well as drafts of translations, and essays on literature. Additional manuscripts of O'Grady's work may also be found in the diaries located in Subseries 4.1, Personal and family items.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Organized into five subseries: (2.1) Poems, (2.2) Prose, (2.3) Translations by O'Grady, (2.4) Translations of O'Grady, and (2.5) Notebooks.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Organized into two groups: (2.1a) Collected poems and (2.1b) Uncollected poems.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The series consists of both critical and creative works by other writers. The works are arranged alphabetically by author. Works by unidentified authors are arranged alphabetically by title at the end of each subseries. Many of the works are dedicated to O'Grady.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Organized into two subseries: (3.1) Poems by others, (3.2) Prose by others, and (3.3) Translations by others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The series consists of personal files of Desmond O'Grady including diaries and subject files. Of particular interest in Subseries 4.1 are the diaries 1964-2001 in which O'Grady recorded his thoughts and feelings on the major events in his life.

The subject files (Subseries 4.2) contain printed material and correspondence relating to specific individuals such as Katherine Washburn and Noel Harrington and organizations such as Aosdana. Some subject files such as the Katherine Washburn, Noel Harrington, and Teaching Material files were created by O'Grady. Other files, such as Aosdana, financial papers, and drawings, were artificially assembled out of similar materials found throughout the papers.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Organized into two subseries: (4.1) Personal and family items and (4.2) Subject files.

did.unittitle: Last Will and Testament of Desmond James Bernard O'Grady [RESTRICTED]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Desmond O'Grady papers include many collected publications--clippings and entire magazines and journals--with material by or about O'Grady. These printed materials have been arranged into three Subseries. Subseries 5.1 contains Writings by O'Grady and is divided under the headings, Publications with poems and Publications with prose and interviews. O'Grady's printed works are arranged alphabetically by title. Writings about O'Grady (Subseries 5.2) contains Reviews and Profiles and promotional items arranged alphabetically by title. Subseries 5.3, Other printed material, includes Individual printed works by others (alphabetical by author when known, by title when author is unidentified), Magazines and Pamphlets (alphabetical by title), Art exhibit pamphlets (alphabetical by artist when known, by title when artist is unknown or multiple artists contributed to exhibit), Miscellaneous/Newspaper clippings (alphabetical by subject), and Promotional items.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Organized into three subseries: (5.1) Writings by O'Grady, (5.2) Writings about O'Grady, and (5.3) Other printed material.
